answers.answer: National curative health programs (PNSC) are a set of measures focused on ensuring specific treatment for diseases with a major impact on public health, with an emphasis on treatment.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Within the PNSC, patients can benefit from medicine, sanitary materials, medical devices, specific services (e.g., radiotherapy, dialysis), and specific investigations (e.g., glycosylated hemoglobin dosage, PET-CT). For chronic renal failure patients, non-medicalized transport and monthly transport of specific materials are also provided.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Medicines granted under the PNSC can be dispensed through community pharmacies (open-circuit) or hospital pharmacies (closed-circuit), depending on the specific disease or condition.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: A specialist doctor can decide to enroll a patient in a PNSC based on their condition, health, and eligibility criteria. Patients must contact a specialist doctor working in a health unit that runs the respective program.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the section under 'Enrollment of patients in a national curative health program:'.

answers.answer: Treatment is primarily prescribed by a specialist doctor. For certain ailments, a family doctor can also prescribe treatment if based on a medical letter issued by the specialist doctor.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the section under 'Enrollment of patients in a national curative health program:'.

answers.answer: The national curative health programs run by CNAS include programs for Cardiovascular Disease, Oncology, Diabetes, Neurological diseases, Hemophilia and Thalassemia, Rare diseases, Mental Health, Endocrine diseases, Orthopedics, Organ transplantation, Renal function replacement, Intensive therapy of liver failure, and the National PET-CT program.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the section under 'The national curative health programs run by CNAS are:'.

answers.answer: National curative health programs, which emphasize treatment, are run by the National Health Insurance House.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/national-curative-health-programs and read the page carefully.
